name: immature
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 disapproving not behaving in a way that is as calm and wise as people expect from someone of your age: Stop being so silly and immature, Chris! She's rather immature for her age, don't you think? Synonyms
childish disapproving
juvenile disapproving
puerile disapproving
disapproving not having much experience of something: politically immature
biology
  specialized not yet completely grown or developed: While the animals are still immature, they do not breed.

not completely developed physically, mentally, or emotionally, or lacking the expected type of responsible behavior for your age: Some of the boys in my class are so immature – they’re always doing silly things. immaturity noun [ U ] us
